item.description:

I don’t know how other revisions handle this, but I know PI handles things like this:

== would be specifically this group or this person and so on

=> this and anything greater than
[/quote]

I hope you aren’t serious.[/quote]

Oh fucking hell 

HA.

item.title: Pots command
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Kodiak, post:11, topic:471441”]I don’t know how other revisions handle this, but I know PI handles things like this:

== would be specifically this group or this person and so on

=> this and anything greater than

so… && c.playerRights => 1 would be moderators and anything of higher power. (i know this is messy but you get my point)[/quote]
Er… Um… Wat?
You put the +, -, >, <, etc, in front of the equals sign in java…
http://www.cafeaulait.org/course/week2/03.html < Read up on your operators Kodiak

Illadelph:

In the pi he has without the && c.playerrights it wont work for normal players… just admins+

That’s why I believe he put it in the adminCommands void. (Kind of like I set up for your server Illadelph)

Read full topic

item.title: Pots command
item.dc:creator: @Illadelph Illadelph
item.description:
@Illadelph wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:471441”][quote author=Kodiak link=topic=588976.msg4174849#msg4174849 date=1354859719]

try

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“pots”)) {
if (c.playerRights == 0)
c.getItems().addItem(145, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(157, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(163, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(3026, 2);

or if errors

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“pots”) && c.playerRights == 0) {
c.getItems().addItem(145, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(157, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(163, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(3026, 2);

You left out a parenthesis. Read this line again:

You didn’t account for the 4th parenthesis.

[/quote]
Oh, and he wanted it for everyone. So there should be no need for the && c.playerRights. But worse comes to worst set the player rights to && c.playerRights >= 0); {[/quote]

In the pi he has without the && c.playerrights it wont work for normal players… just admins+

Read full topic

item.title: Pots command
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

I don’t know how other revisions handle this, but I know PI handles things like this:

== would be specifically this group or this person and so on

=> this and anything greater than

so… && c.playerRights => 1 would be moderators and anything of higher power. (i know this is messy but you get my point)

item.title: Pots command
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Forsakinpkers, post:1, topic:471441”]i dont really get why this does not work for normall players with player rights of 1 but it only fors for player rights 3 and up can anyone tell me why?

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("pots")) { c.getItems().addItem(145, 1); c.getItems().addItem(157, 1); c.getItems().addItem(163, 1); c.getItems().addItem(3026, 2);[/quote]
Come again?
I don’t know if you’re using a PI with a more stable commands file, where you might have put it in a void that makes it for people that have playerRights 1 or above…
Something like this:
public void adminCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)
{
//Your command here.

In that case, only people with the correct rights (Defined near the top of the file) can use what ever command is in it.

Read full topic
